articles.author: Brian Mann
articles.title: COVID-19 has scrambled New Year's Eve plans — again. And Americans aren't happy - NPR
articles.description: Skyrocketing COVID-19 case rates have caused officials In New York City and elsewhere to scale back their New Year's Eve celebrations. Around the country, people are facing tough decisions.
articles.content:
The 2022 sign that will be lit on top of a building on New Year's Eve is displayed in New York's Times Square earlier this month.
Seth Wenig/AP
When Pam Mandel got the phone call this week that her… [+5344 chars]

articles.title: CDC backs corporate demands to force the sick back to work - WSWS
articles.description: The Biden administration has made clear that preventing Americans from contracting, and dying from, COVID-19 is no longer a goal of public policy.
articles.content: On Monday, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) updated its guidelines for isolation and quarantine times, cutting the recommended isolation period for people infected with COVID-1… [+9339 chars]
